title: Cereal Time
question_text:
Two top cereal producers were competing with each other by putting game cards in their cereal boxes. Bix cereal claimed that $22\%$ of their boxes contained winning cards and Bops cereal claimed that $20\%$ of their boxes contained winning cards. In an attempt to test this, a consumer goods company purchased $40$ boxes of Bix and $38$ boxes of Bops cereals.
What is the probability that the proportion of winning cards in Bops was $15\%$ or less of the winning cards in Bix?
